executive_summary.one_line_conclusion: Renewable energy transition in industrial manufacturing requires a phased approach balancing environmental benefits, economic costs, and regulatory support.

three_bullets.bullet: Significant environmental benefits achievable with solar and wind technologies
Economic viability depends on government incentives and technology costs
Policy coordination required across multiple jurisdictions

expert_agreement.environmental_impact: Consistent agreement on environmental benefits with ratings of 8-9/10
expert_agreement.economic_feasibility: Experts identified 70% agreement on feasibility with conditions
expert_agreement.policy_necessity: Full consensus on need for regulatory support (9/10 average)

implementation_pathway.phase_1: Initial pilot programs for high-impact, low-cost transitions
implementation_pathway.phase_2: Scaling based on pilot results and policy developments
implementation_pathway.phase_3: Full transition with mature technologies and stable policies
